title: BlackRock's bitcoin ETF added to DTCC file in Aug - DTCC spokesperson
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has proposed a Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) which was added to a clearing-house eligibility file in August. However, this move does not imply any regulatory approval. The ETF is still in the proposal stage and is subject to regulatory approval before it can be launched. This development is significant as it indicates BlackRock's interest in the cryptocurrency market. However, the regulatory landscape for cryptocurrency ETFs remains uncertain. The sales team should monitor this situation closely as it could potentially open up a new market segment for ETF sales.
